title: Enhancing Practical Curriculum Development Competencies: Designing Mathematical Modeling for ICT-Enabled Music Composition

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational music theory, understanding of algorithmic concepts, and intermediate mathematical modeling proficiency
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Design at least two composition models that convert musical scales, rhythms, and harmonies into mathematical variables using ICT tools.
Analyze provided musical constraints (proscriptions) and create at least one creative work that transcends them.

Learners Select at Least Three Mathematical Principles (Probability, Graph Theory, etc.) Applied in the Composition Process, Write a 500-Character Report Analyzing the Impact of Each Principle on Musical Structure, and Achieve a Grade of 'B+' or Higher in at Least Two of the Three Evaluation Criteria Provided by the Instructor (Clarity, Logic, Creativity)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
